entry.et: Middle English beaute, bealte, from Anglo-French, from bel, beau beautiful, from Latin bellus pretty; akin to Latin bonus good bounty

def.dt: :the quality or aggregate of qualities in a person or thing that gives pleasure to the senses or pleasurably exalts the mind or spirit :loveliness
:a particularly graceful, ornamental, or excellent quality
:a brilliant, extreme, or egregious example or instance that mistake was a beauty
:a Chinese shrub (Kolkwitzia amabilis) of the honeysuckle family with pinkish flowers and bristly fruit
:an assemblage of girls or women at which judges select the most beautiful called also beauty pageant
:a presidential primary election in which the popular vote does not determine the number of convention delegates a candidate receives
:the most desirable or beneficial aspect of something
:a beautiful and glamorous woman or girl
:an establishment or department where hairdressing, facials, and manicures are done called also beauty parlor beauty salon
:a woman in a bathing suit who is a contestant in a beauty contest
:any of a genus (Rhexia of the family Melastomaceae, the meadow-beauty family) of perennial North American herbs with showy solitary or cymose flowers

entry.et: probably from Rome, village in Adams County, Ohio

def.dt: :a round red apple that has firm slightly tart flesh and is used especially for baking called also Rome
